is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks.android

Class SchedulerOperationTimeout

  • java.lang.Object
    • is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks.android.SchedulerOperationTimeout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OperationTimeout

    public final class SchedulerOperationTimeout
extends java.lang.Object
implements OperationTimeout
    Simple implementation of OperationTimeout that uses deferred workers.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public void schedule()
        Description copied from interface: OperationTimeout
        Called by GattPeripheral. Schedules a timeout timer.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after OperationTimeout.setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

        Specified by:
        schedule in interface OperationTimeout

      • unschedule

        public void unschedule()
        Description copied from interface: OperationTimeout
        Called by GattPeripheral. Unschedules the timeout timer.

        It is a valid condition for this method to be called multiple times, it should become a no-op after the first call.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after OperationTimeout.setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

        Specified by:
        unschedule in interface OperationTimeout

      • reschedule

        public void reschedule()
        Description copied from interface: OperationTimeout
        For use by clients. Unschedules and reschedules the timeout timer.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after OperationTimeout.setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

        Specified by:
        reschedule in interface OperationTimeout

      • setTimeoutAction

        public void setTimeoutAction(rx.functions.Action0 action,
                             rx.Scheduler scheduler)
        Description copied from interface: OperationTimeout
        Called by GattPeripheral. Specifies an action to run when the timeout expires that will allow the stack to clean up any resources.

        Client code should check the state of a peripheral after a timeout has expired.

        Specified by:
        setTimeoutAction in interface OperationTimeout
        Parameters:
        action - Stack specific logic to handle the timeout.
        scheduler - The scheduler to run the handler on.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.
